sub: POLITICO Illinois Playbook, presented by Nuclear Matters: Another go at AFSCME override â€“ DEMS' dim gov prospects â€“ RAHM keeps his distance from SPRINGFIELD
body: am edtby natasha korecki nkorecki politico com natashakorecki and brianna gurciullo bgurciullo politico com brigurciullo good wednesday morning illinois there s buzz in springfield over another override attempt of the so called afscme arbitration bill hb that s after some labor reps rallied in the capital streets last week labor is mike madigan s fiercest ally in this protracted battle between the speaker and gov bruce rauner which is why we re likely to see another vote to override as early as today that s despite an expectation that it just doesn t have enough support to get it over the goal line with the may budget deadline creeping closer we ve yet to see a true budget compromise materialize though talks continue rauner s office is pushing hard for an agreed budget bill by that deadline and there was new talk tuesday night about a potential attempt involving some democrats to try to block a dem only unbalanced budget from passing in the house one that rauner is already swearing to veto the thinking is that by blocking a madigan drafted budget both sides would be forced to compromise and schools and social services would be funded on time it s a longshot to say the least given that a pre midnight roll call would need votes to pass and there s democrats in that chamber even if you subtract common nay dem votes like ken dunkin jack franks and scott drury any rebellion would have to be significant on education as we ve previously reported madigan wants schools to open on time and does not intend to hold up k school funding how many times can the same bill fail up next union arbitration veto override try two by illinois public radio s amanda vinicky democratic rep emanuel chris welch says he plans to call the measure for a vote i think the rally in springfield last week was very impressive and people are hearing that so we re going to put it on the board and see if the votes are there the legislation would require stalled contract talks to be settled by an arbitrator it s the second time rauner vetoed the idea house democrats previous attempt to override him fell three votes short the governor has called it the worst bill he s seen but unions say rauner is trying to force a strikenot liking it editorial boards from the peoria journal star to the daily herald have railed against the bill here s a sampling democratic bench not deep brown democrats short list of gov candidates is pretty short by chicago sun times mark brown sen dick durbin would rather guys like me not write about the possibility of him running for governor against bruce rauner in unfortunately for democrats the list of strong contenders is short after lisa madigan the list is less obvious state treasurer michael frerichs was elected in with rauner and appears to covet the governor s job but may not have the stature at this point frerichs moved into the treasurer s post from the illinois senate where several of his former colleagues daniel biss andy manar kwame raoul and heather steans adding whoever runs against rauner must be prepared to go up against the former private equity investor s bottomless pit of money and the monsoon of opposition research and negative attacks that rauner is capable of financing some insiders are estimating republicans may spend million in the next gubernatorial campaign dems wouldn t have to match that dollar for dollar but they d have to raise million to stay competitive that s why party insiders are looking to persuade big guns like durbin and to a lesser degree arne duncan lisa madigan would be a formidable opponent if her father agreed to step down as speaker if she were elected while brown notes other rising stars they d have a tough road ahead building name recognition and creating a strong organization while battling the rauner jabs brown s kicker seems appropriate here add it all up and what do you get a lot more speculation about durbin being the candidate welcome to the politico illinois playbook have a tip event announcement endorsement send to nkorecki politico com or natashakorecki a message from nuclear matters illinois nuclear energy plants provide percent of our carbon free electricity and contribute nearly billion to our economy without illinois policymakers support for the next generation energy plan two plants clinton and quad cities could be forced to close jeopardizing these benefits and thousands of jobs learn more nuclearmatters com pro sanders people s summit comes to chicago from a release an all star line up of progressive and community leaders and activists from across the u s will gather in chicago june for a people s summit to in part continue the momentum and movement building associated with the ongoing bernie sanders campaign sen sanders is one of the invited speakers to the summit percent approval rauner s approval rating sinks to record low by crain s greg hinz according to the survey by ogden amp frye for the insider a political newsletter just percent of likely voters surveyed now approve of the job the republican governor is doing a whopping percent disapprove as recently as january rauner s disapproval rating was only percent so if ogden amp frye s findings are accurate rauner s numbers are headed south he s particularly weak among independents just percent approve of the job he s done so far now insider publisher david ormsby is a former aide to house speaker mike madigan rauner s bitter foe and as rauner spokeswomanpro auto vote group targets house members ivote is targeting illinois house members with digital ads that begin today and run through friday urging their support for sb state sen andy manar s automatic voter registration bill the bill passed the senate the group plans in digital ads over three days an effort they ve joined with the united food and commercial workers ufcw local senators sam mccann chapin rose sue rezin neil anderson and jason barickman the republican senators who voted for the manar avr bill in the illinois senate if it advances and is signed into law illinois will become the fifth state to have automatic voter registration behind california oregon vermont and west virginia local fbi agents shot in gang sweep fbi agents wounded in bid to nab reputed gang member suspect dead in park forest by chicago tribune s jason meisner the daily southtown s zak koeske and freelance reporter dennis sullivan two fbi agents serving an arrest warrant suffered non life threatening gunshot wounds tuesday morning at a park forest home and a suspect in the residence was found dead according to the fbi the cook county medical examiner s office identified the dead man as melvin toran toran was a reputed high ranking member of the black p stone nation street gang according to a federal law enforcement source fbi agents had gone to the home in the south suburb of chicago to arrest him on charges of narcotics trafficking part of a gang sweep involving several other ranking members of the gang trib in xkmjt new ruling set stricter employer standards overtime misconduct rules a big change in workplace by the state journal register s tim landis changes in federal overtime rules are not the only big shift in the workplace for illinois employers and employees an illinois supreme court ruling and a new state law that took effect in january also have set stricter standards for employers who wish to contest unemployment benefits sought by fired workers employment law specialists told a seminar of the greater springfield chamber of commerce on tuesday approximately business owners and managers attended the session at the statehouse inn in springfield a dog is in this fight u of i lawmaker spar over research on dogs cats by chicago tribune s celeste bott under a measure nicknamed the beagle bill sen linda holmes started out wanting to require universities to offer healthy cats and dogs to rescue organizations when they are no longer needed for testing the democrat from aurora who describes herself as a longtime animal lover and former humane society volunteer argues that since research dogs and cats cost thousands of dollars taxpayers should be given the chance to adopt the animals from chicago or springfield equally unsuccessful lightning rod emanuel leaning against springfield visit to lobby on cps funding by chicago tribune s john byrne and celeste bott so far mayor rahm emanuel isn t having his security guards gas up the black suv or preparing a private plane for takeoff for a quick trip to springfield as lawmakers try to come up with a school funding plan in the final week of spring session there s a lot at stake cps is looking for hundreds of millions of dollars of state help to keep the district afloat as a huge teachers pension payment is due at the end of june the mayor said tuesday that there s more than one way to make the city s case republicans go after madigan blockade lawmaker meetings continue but no state budget by wttw s nick blumberg there was a flurry of late session activity in the illinois house and senate on tuesday but still no budget deal a group of republican state senators on tuesday morning repeated gov bruce rauner s message from the last several days that democratic house speaker michael madigan is standing in the way of reform and contributing to a dip in illinois population are people really leaving this state because their taxes are too low asked state sen dave syverson r rockford are they really leaving illinois because we have too many jobs to offer their children no thecity keeping rebellion at bay political operative trying to tame rebellious city council by sun times fran spielman three years ago anna valencia was the striking brunette in an elle magazine spread on the politics of power dressing a year old assistant to mayor rahm emanuel she was interviewed and photographed in designer clothing shoes handbags and jewelry hand picked by the magazine the story was about what to wear to office meetings fundraisers and other work related events now valencia is dressing for success on her own dime with even higher stakes as emanuel s political point person otherwise known as director of the office of legislative counsel and governmentduncan dips into new waters arne duncan named to lucas museum board of directors the former cps superintendent and u s secretary of education was named to the museum s board tuesday by nbc ward room s tom schuba lucas museum officials announced the appointment of arne duncan as a member of its board of directors tuesday i am delighted to have the opportunity to join the board of this truly exceptional nonprofit museum and to have the opportunity to work with pioneers like george and mellody duncan said in a statement this museum will inspire the next generation of artists and storytellers duncan a chicago native previously served as chicago public schools superintendentwhy some residents won t be going amid gun violence west side residents wary of summer in the park by cltv mayor rahm emanuel wants everyone to enjoy chicago s parks this summer but some residents say they re afraid to use them especially lafollette park in the austin neighborhood amid much pomp and circumstance mayor emanuel announced the fourth annual night out in the parks program at lafollette park on the west side there will be free events across the city during the summer including five on the west side since the beginning of the year there have been shootings including four murders within several blocks of lafollette park one was on the corner of hirschburbs education department and district officials that allowed a transgender student who identifies as a girl to use the girls bathroom but monday s motion also took aim at the obama administration s sweeping guidance that transgender individuals are to enjoy the full spectrum of rights provided under title ix the federal law prohibiting sex based discrimination in schools and school activities and are to have their sex and therefore access to bathrooms and locker rooms defined by their gender identity boys who perceive themselves as girls are still biologically and anatomically male the motion argues it violates and humiliates the girls that a boy might see them undressed or that they might see him undressed and that they have to share such intimate settings as a locker room or restroom children are not guinea pigs and they should not be subjected to social experimentation to further political agendas as the price for a public education a title ix irony the motion makes arguments against the agreement and the administration s guidance that you ll hear plenty more of in the future namely that the obama administration overstepped its constitutional authority and has deprived students of their right to privacy but the plaintiffs attorneys are also trying to turn the administration s argument for the guidance against itself ironically the district violates title ix by doing what doe says it must do to comply with title ix the motion contends granting students access to restrooms and locker rooms based on gender identity creates a hostile environment and also provides unequal locker room facilities to girls put simply doe s redefinition of the term sex in title ix makes it impossible for schools to comply with the statute argonne looks to change the landscape of energy argonne launching first technology incubator for clean energy ideas by the daily herald s marie wilson ideas for the clean energy of the future could find a launchpad at a new program at argonne national laboratory near darien chain reaction innovators is seeking science minded entrepreneurs with ideas who want to connect with expert researchers world class technology and mentorship at the laboratory to develop those ideas with roughly million from the u s department of energy and million from argonne the program expects to support about a dozen projects that could change the landscape of energy said mark johnson today s event courtesy of intelligentevent is chicago shrinking amp what will the chicago political landscape be in aldertrack aldertrack is proud to present two panel discussions that will explore the political and demographic future of chicago is chicago shrinking panelists include demographer robert paral urban planner richard wilson and mpc director marisa novara chicago politics panel include greg golder of resolute consulting brian sleet of the kim foxx campaign amp businessman victor reyes where s rahm no schedule provided where s rauner no public events a message from nuclear matters some of america s existing nuclear energy plants face early closure due to current economic and policy conditions providing more than of america s carbon free electricity existing state of the art nuclear energy plants play a vital role in achieving our clean energy and carbon reduction goals in illinois our nuclear energy plants provide percent of the state s electricity and percent of our carbon free electricity the existing nuclear energy plants also contribute nearly billion to the economy and support approximately direct and indirect jobs but today illinois doesn t properly value these plants for their carbon free contributions placing them in economic jeopardy without support from illinois policymakers for the next generation energy plan to close this gap two plants clinton and quad cities could be forced to close jeopardizing thousands of jobs along with many other economic and environmental benefits learn more at nuclearmatters com to view online

sub: Digital Campaign Tools for State Parties
body: state parties effective field campaigning requires the ability to continuously engage donors key stakeholders and constituency groups in your state technology has made it easier to streamline communication across your campaign and translate that communication into tangible results we look forward to speaking with you this thursday vannavanna curetraining directorassociation of state democratic chairsand not authorized by any candidate or candidate s committee

sub: The Foundation of Contract Drafting: Essential Components, Provisions and Proper Safeguards.
body: to see the web version of this message click here in conjunction with commerciallawwebadvisorthe foundation of contract drafting the devil is in the detailsthe basics of drafting a well crafted contract including essential components provisions and proper safeguards to protect your institution s interests at the outset of any relationship everyone tends to be filled with enthusiasm the prospects for profits the anticipation of progress and the excitement of a new entrepreneurial enterprise may tempt the parties to give short shrift to the details of their contract they can t wait to get their joint activities underway but experienced professionals know that a well drafted contract can serve to define the parties relationship in order to avoid conflicts down the road and as the vehicle for conflict resolution when things go south ambiguities omissions and inconsistencies can doom the relationship and complicate any subsequent conflicts this webinar will examine the basics of contract drafting including the essential components of almost any commercial contract whether employment sales services or real estate boilerplate what s essential what s only nice and what is simply bloat dispute resolution the pros and cons of all the options term and termination provisions warranties waivers indemnities and insurance coverages and much more please join dr jim castagnera esq as he covers the core principles that should appear in any well drafted contract to help ensure that the parties relationship on paper is well defined and includes the proper safeguards to protect your institution s interests date may pm eastern duration scheduled for minutes including question and answer session price â webinar cd webinar cd each live option may be viewed by unlimited attendees from the same connection cd includes recorded presentation question and answer session and presentation slides cd options are subject to a handling charge cpe credits live webinar approved for nasba credit hours management advisory services business law presenter â dr james ottavio castagnera attorney at law who should attend financial officers in house counsel corporate attorneys general counsel your conference leaderyour conference leader for the foundation of contract drafting the devil is in the details is dr jim castagnera esq dr castagnera holds a jd and a phd from case western reserve university he was a labor employment and ip lawyer with a major philadelphia law firm for a decade before becoming rider university s legal counsel for academic affairs for the past years in that capacity his duties have included drafting reviewing and enforcing labor and employment contracts internship affiliation and student exchange agreements government grants and contracts and international memorandums of understanding he has taught law at the wharton school of the university of pennsylvania the widener university law school and currently the drexel university school of law he has published books including the employment law answer book forms and worksheets wolters kluwer a page compendium of model contracts and policies including executive compensation termination non compete and confidentiality and sales representative agreements financialofficerwebadvisor quality commitmentfinancialofficerwebadvisor a division of dkg media lp wants you to be satisfied with your webinar if this webinar does not meet your expectations email us atâ service financialofficerwebadvisor com mailto service financialofficerwebadvisor com â â certificate of participationfinancialofficerwebadvisor certificates of participation are available to everyone completing this webinar about commerciallawwebadvisor â commerciallawwebadvisor s mission is to provide timely and authoritative information to commercial lawyers in house counsel and legal staff via our comprehensive webinars thank you for reading thisâ financialofficerwebadvisorâ advertisement s mopac expressway â â â barton oaks plaza v suite â â â austin texas â â service financialofficerwebadvisor com

tech clipsandy amsler campaigns and electionsthe new york times has already dubbed hillary clintonâ s campaign the â ultimateâ startup and there is no shortage of articles like this one from fast company drawing a line between president obamaâ s campaign apparatus and the â lean startupâ model the comparison of course has its merits startups and presidential campaigns raise and spend money at an aggressive clip they scale and grow exponentially they build a culture where young and fresh minds can thrive and they share a bias for data and testing at their core campaigns are entrepreneurial and innovative just like startups but hereâ s where the two diverge while the greatest startups in the world go on to release newer better products year after year much of the r amp d that is poured into a presidential campaign is lost after election day wiped away virtually overnight ezra klein voxgizmodo s report that facebook s trending box was curated by a liberal leaning staff that suppressed stories from conservative outlets hit like a bomb the revelation has been greeted with outrage and rightly so trending shouldn t be an ideological concept the furor grew loud enough that mark zuckerberg has now responded in the coming weeks he promised i ll also be inviting leading conservatives and people from across the political spectrum to talk with me about this and share their points of view i want to have a direct conversation the ceo s attention to the problem of biased curators should be enough to solve it but here s the truth facebook â at least as people really experience it â is likely to get more biased not less as a result of this controversy hadas gold politicoconservative media figures will meet facebook founder mark zuckerberg this week at facebook headquarters in california the group will include tv and radio host glenn beck redstate twitchy townhall and hotair general manager jonathan garthwaite mitt romney s former digital director zac moffat and republican pollster and washington examiner columnist kristen soltis anderson donald trump adviser barry bennett fox news dana perino and cnn s s e cupp are also attending according to cnn samuel woolley and ben howard wireddonald trump understands minority communities just ask pepe luis lopez francisco palma and alberto contreras these guys are among the candidateâ s million twitter followers and each tweeted in support of trump after his victory in the nevada caucuses earlier this year the problem is pepe francisco and alberto arenâ t people theyâ re botsâ spam accounts that post autonomously using programmed scripts trumpâ s rhetoric has alienated much of the latino electorate a fast growing voting community and while itâ s unclear whoâ s behind the accounts of pepe and his digital pals their tweets succeed in impersonating latino voters at a time when the real estate mogul needs them most james hercher adexchangerblood in the water brings sharks and high cpms bring bots and political spenders who often outbid brands on targeted inventory are uniquely vulnerable to digital fraud and bots â all the ingredients that typically happen for fraud are a part of the political marketplace â said mark schlosser senior sales director at the ad fraud security firm white ops whoâ s building out the firmâ s political business hallmarks of both fraud and political advertising include money being suddenly dumped into specific publishers on short flight campaigns lots of first party profile data and cookie based targeting according to schlosser ed kilgore new york magazineâ trump has no plans to invest in the kind of data driven voter targeting operation that powered obama s two white house wins and that mitt romney tried to emulate in i ve always felt it was overrated trump told the ap obama got the votes much more so than his data processing machine and i think the same is true with me instead trump will rely on a large rally based get out the vote effort â maybe he s just jiving us but the idea of a data free general election campaign horrifying as it must be to republican professionals is entirely consistent with everything else we know about trump s idea of campaigning philip rosenstein mediapostas the grand old party rips open at the seams political marketers are taking a closer look at an emerging demographic group within the republican party â one significantly distinct from the traditional republican demographic red white amp blog spoke with bryan melmed vice president of insights services at exponential to probe the many changes in the political sphere melmed remarked that â the situation on the ground is moving particularly quickly the idea of the typical republican is a crude stereotype that will no longer satisfy the needs of political marketers â how different are trump voters compared to the republicans marketers engaged with in associated press new york timesdonald trump says he plans to win the white house largely on the strength of his personality brushing off the need for a heavy investment in what he calls the overrated use of data to shape campaign strategy and get out the vote should he hold to that approach which he outlined last week in an interview with the associated press trump will flout all conventions of what it takes to win a modern presidential campaign by doing so critics in both parties argue he d give up what could be a strategic advantage over hillary clinton his expected democratic opponent

sub: The Daily 202: After Trump's Indiana romp, anti-Trump Republicans consider their options, including voting for Hillary Clinton
body: the daily from powerpostted cruz exits stage rightâ â if you re having trouble reading this â click here lt view url gt james hohmann is on vacation we ll have a series of guest writers from the post political team sharing their analysis with you this week last night the unimaginable happened for many establishment republicans pundits and conservatives donald trump effectively became their standard bearer for president rnc chair reince priebus said as much in a post indiana primary tweet after the donald beat ted cruz with over percent of the vote and stands aâ good chance of collecting all delegates available in the state â trump for his part â chose to take the high road when it came to lyin ted but only after the texas senator had officiallyâ exited stage right â ted cruz iâ don t know if he likes me or doesn t like me but he is one hell of a competitor trump said in his victory speech he is a tough smart guy and he has got an amazing future iâ want to congratulateâ ted trump said â the real estate mogul also praised priebus saying it sâ not an easy job when he had egos former gop presidential candidates and now i guess he s down to one he said joking â i don t know is there a second iâ don t know trump talked veepstakes on good morning america wednesday morning saying as he has previously his running mate willâ most likely be an elected official and perhaps more significantly that his vp nomineeâ â will â definitelyâ be a republican heâ also refused to apologize fo citing the unsubstantiated report about cruz s dad and oswald i don t think anybody denied it he told abc news george stephanopoulos the problem became crystal clear after trump won indiana last night when a slew of conservative bloggers and thought leaders took to social media to show photos of themselves destroying their republican voter registration cards and in some cases saying i mwithher using the hashtag for hillary clinton s campaign the idea that leading conservatives would rather vote for a clinton than pull the lever for their own party s presidential nominee however distasteful is astounding it remains to be seen whether these conservatives will follow through on their public threats but they re laying down a pretty clearâ gauntlet before trump has even formally clinched the gop nod we also don t know if some ofâ themâ and republican voters who dislike trump will simply stay home in november or actually vote for hillary but even the prospect of such a mutiny should send shivers down the spine of mitch mcconnell and paul ryan who are seeking to protect their congressional majorities this year a national review writer posted this after the indiana results came in here sâ lachlan markey theâ free beacon writer burning his voter registration card from the editor of the washington examiner a red state contributor one of john mccain s closest former strategists â indiana further confirmed the â stop trumpâ efforts didnâ t work and spending even more resources in an effort keep him from the nomination will just be expensive political therapy or theatre at this point â saidâ former minnesota governor tim pawlenty conservative blogger erick erickson a staunch trump critic said he and other activists plan to hold a conference call wednesday to discuss strategy moving forward â â â someâ conservatives held the line on nevertrumpâ but didn t say what they ll do next and the headlines for republicans were brutal this morning or in a literal hot takeâ from the independent journal review s benny johnson in case you were wondering john kasich vowed to stay in the race welcome to the daily powerpost s morning newsletter cruz exits the race ted cruz walks away after announcing the suspension of his campaign during his election night watch party in indianapolis â photo by joe raedle getty images cruz suspended his presidential bid last night after failing to expand his appeal outside of his partyâ s most conservative and most evangelical sections â iâ ve said that i would continue on as long as there is a viable path to victory â the texas senator said in his concession speech â tonight iâ m sorry to say it appears that path has been foreclosed â watch cruz suspend his camnpaign and hear trump s reaction cruz drops out as trump celebrates â amazingâ night in indianawatch cruz accidentally elbow his wife heidi in the head at his concession speech after dropping out of presidential race ted cruz just hit his wife w a elbow headshotobservers noted that cruz failed one on one with trump a strategy he s yearned for and theâ fiorina pick was a flop in this nov photo charlie keating iv poses for a photo in phoenix for an upcoming series on the discovery channel that he took part in the navy seal killed in iraq onâ may sherrie buzby the arizona republic via ap while you were sleeping get smart fast â â hoosiers feel the bern bernie sanders speaks at a campaign event on the campus of indiana university in fort wayne on may photo by scott olson getty images but on tuesday he vowed to keep up the fight â â the clinton campaign thinks this is over theyâ re wrong â sanders said inâ aâ statement â maybe itâ s over for the insiders and the party establishment but the voters in indiana had a different idea â the campaign wasnâ t over for them it isnâ t over for the voters in west virginia it isnâ t over for democrats in oregon new jersey and kentucky it isnâ t over for voters in california and all the other states with contests still to come â â ron pollackâ is departing the head of families usa after more than three decades â photo by marvin joseph the washington post wapo highlights social media speed read watch jake tapper debunk trump s theory that cruz s father helped jfk s assassin here s roger stone s reaction cruz s campaign got in on the fun matt drudge trolled the msm over all the talk of a contested convention before cruz exited the race trump was not so kind to the senator in his twitter feed â michelle obama and jill biden appeared on the voice a few congressional birthdays to celebrate hot on the left â â hot on the right daybook on the campaign trail here s the rundown clinton washington d c sanders lexington ky kasich dulles va at the white house president obama travels to flint mich to check on the response to the city s water crisis obama will receive a briefing participate in a roundtable and deliver remarks in the evening back in washington d c he will speak at a gala dinner for the asian pacific american institute of congressional studies vice president biden chairs the u s caribbean central american energy summit in washington d c on capitol hill the senate and house are not in session news you can use if you live in d c videos of the day watch trump allege that cruz s dad is the one in the picture with lee harvey oswald the rafael cruz segment starts at about fourâ minutes in donald trump full interview on fox amp friends fox news and see cruz respond by calling trump a pathological liar and serial philanderer cruz calls trump pathological liar serial philanderer quick throwback to the time cruz said he d continue to sing donald s praises personally clinton chatted with amy poehler about parks and recreation s leslie knope in honor of the indiana primary check out this emotionalâ ad from maggie hassan s campaign against kelly ayotte got involvedfans around the world celebrated leicester city s fairytale title success fans around the world celebrate leicester city s fairytale title successseth meyers discussed single payer health care single payer healthcare a closer lookcheck out the atmosphere in north korea where post correspondent anna fifield is holding a congress of its ruling worker s party the post in north korea first steps on the groundfinally watch as a pilot father surprises his soldier son on his flight home from deployment watch pilot dad surprises son on his flight home from deploymentâ the washington post â â k st nw washington dc â â

sub: POLITICO's 2016 Blast: Oregon and Kentucky vote â€” Trumpâ€™s general election moves â€” Nevada chaos highlights Democratsâ€™ fears â€” 5 things you need to know
body: by henry c jackson pm edtstill voting here here we go again kentucky and oregon democrats vote tonight collectively they ll give bernie sanders the chance to pick up two more victories but stop us if you ve heard this before they likely won t change his ability to win in the big race against hillary clinton it s tuesday turn on some bluegrass and enjoy yet another primary night in america oh and here s your blast henry c jackson henrycjjackson is here to guide you through the day s campaign news so send your tips complaints and best cockpit chatter to hjackson politico com trail mix elsewhere on the campaign trail mitch mcconnell gives a nudge donald trump is a polling menace his lawyer drops a lawsuit before it starts j k rowling defends him sort of the actor who played bunk attempts to debunk hillary clinton is big in albania marshawn lynch keeps bill clinton in check and clinton county isn t clinton country blast note the blast does not like to rank its favorites but if think you have an argument for why any show is better than the wire we re all ears what s next voting is happening now in oregon and kentucky bernie sanders decamps for northern california tomorrow with stops in vallejo and san jose follow politico s politics team politicocharlie politico steve politicoalex anniekarni glennthrush elistokols katieglueck schreckreports gdebenedetti hadas gold ec schneider kyledcheney theodoricmeyer marcacaputo politicokevin mikeallen dlippman danielstrauss henrycjjackson shanegoldmacher kristinpolitico politicoscott patrick c reisto view online

yes that s correct sent from my iphonescott this event is closed to press right letâ s loop in luis too my first reaction is no but on further thought kruel could turn this back on us and say she was denied attendance by the big bad establishment all finance asked us to vet this dws event attendee for her trip to tn i lean noâ tracie others below is a sampling of her social media posts she also donated to the event which i can refund if she is denied cramanda kruel â multiple tweets throwing shade on dws staunch bernie supporter and campaign staffer was elected delegate for tn at the dncc laurel aveknoxville tn dob employer occupation bernie east tennessee field organizerngp notes nonengp vet history noneevents nonecontributions nonelobbyist doj fara noneearmarks tarp arra noneliens nonejudgments nonebankruptcies nonecriminal records nonelexis nexis internet search yes lt image jpg gt lt image jpg gt lt image jpg gt lt image jpg gt lt image jpg gt lt image jpg gt lt image jpg gt lt image jpg gt lt image jpg gt lt image jpg gt lt image jpg gt lt image jpg gt lt image jpg gt alan reedcompliance directordncw c

mainemaine democrats set sights on unity at state conventiondemocrats from across the state will gather in portland for the annual state party convention beginning friday the goal of the event which will be held friday and saturday at the cross insurance arena is to build party unity but also to select the delegates who will represent maine at the national convention in philadelphia in late july there are passionate supporters on both sides and they are excited about their candidates said maine democratic party chairman phil bartlett bartlett said he expects roughly people to attend and he envisions a smooth event â there are passionate supporters on both sides and they are excited about their candidates â said the former state senator from gorham who has chaired the party since early â weâ ve seen that in other cycles too but i think the party will eventually come together the differences between sanders and clinton pale in comparison to the differences between either one of them and donald trump â marylandstate washington county dems eye resurgence in fall electionwith their eyes on the nov election several of the state s leading democrats gathered in hagerstown on thursday evening for the party s annual washington county jefferson jackson day dinner keynote speakers at the hager hall event were to be u s rep john delaney who is seeking re election to represent maryland s th congressional district and rep chris van hollen the party s nominee for the u s senate seat held by retiring democratic sen barbara mikulski d bruce poole chairman of the maryland democratic party said democrats are making inroads in this part of the state we re getting a resurgence in western and southern maryland he said they re unhappy with what the republicans have been able to deliver they ve been in charge now for some time and a lot of people say boy this isn t working looking toward the possibility of a presidential race pitting democrat hillary clinton against republican donald trump poole said it s going to be an absolutefight and the big issue is going to be what does the governor do he acknowledged that gov larry hogan a republican is very popular missourihubrecht defends rape commentsdemocratic groups are reacting with outrage to comments made by rep tila hubrecht r dexter during debate over a controversial â personhoodâ bill that could make abortion legal in the state the president of the missouri democratic party crystal brinkley called on gubernatorial candidates from the opposing party to renounce hubrechtâ s comments â it is astounding that republicans continue to believe that a woman must bring to term the child of her rapist â brinkley said in a statement â that choice should belong to the victim not jefferson city politicians missourians deserve to know if the republican candidates for governor agree with this outrageous statement â brinkley and other democrats also called the comments â another todd akin moment â akin of course is the former republican missouri congressman who made comments that a womanâ s body could reject a pregnancy in cases of â legitimate rape â those comments alone caused him to lose his bid for sen claire mccaskillâ sseat the missouri democratic state committee has already used the comments to solicit donations north carolinan c gop convention follows dismissal of chairmannorth carolina republican party leaders are anxious to increase harmony within the ranks at this weekend s state convention heading into what points to a perilous â or at least extraordinary â presidential election year for the gop in the week leading up to friday s convention opening in greensboro party activists removed chairman hasan harnett from his job after party leaders accused him of a power grab and trying to break the state party s computer system and party outsider donald trump a divisive candidate nationally became the gop presumptive presidential nominee he s gone after and insulted group after group north carolina democratic party spokesman dave miranda said there is a lot of division now within the gop and trump sort of exemplifies that ohiodemocratic leaders pressure kasich to disclose campaign security costsjohn kasichâ s announcement that he was suspending his campaign democratic leaders are pressuring him to disclose how much he paid for his security along the campaign trail months on the presidential campaign trail drove up the bill to protect kasich estimates several weeks ago backed up by wcpo news partner politifact put that figure at upwards of in taxpayer dollars now legally the kasich campaign is not obligated to disclose the specifics of the cost of his security to ohio taxpayers â now that the campaign is over especially just tell us how much it cost â said ohio democratic party chair david pepper â thereâ s no justification to hide that cost â itâ s a question the kasich campaign has answered time and again as the governorâ s time away grew more considerable his office always said it wonâ t comment on matters of security for him or his family itâ s just something that comes with the job campaign officials say and not authorized by any candidate or candidate s committee

sub: TOMORROW: Join us for a conf. call with HHS Secretary Sylvia Burwell
body: jordan can you join us for tomorrow s conference call with hhs secretary sylvia burwell we will discuss health insurance costs delivery system reform and how the public and private sectors can work together to improve the cost and quality of health care i hope you can make it shumwaydate tuesday may at pmjordan join us for a conference call with hhs secretary sylvia m burwell to discuss the current state of health care in our annual survey of business forward affiliate members a majority of business leaders told us their top concern is health insurance costs this call will provide an opportunity for business leaders to share how health care costs have affected their businesses we will discuss insurance costs delivery system reform and how the public and private sectors can work together to improve the cost and quality of health care can you join our conference call with hhs secretary sylvia burwell here are the details what conference call on health care and insurance costswho sylvia m burwellsecretaryu s department of health and human servicesdr meena seshamanidirector office of health reformu s department of health and human serviceswhen wednesday may p m et a m ptplease note this call is off the record and not for press purposes thanks shumway marshalldigital directorbusiness forward this email was sent to kaplanj dnc org to unsubscribe go to

sub: Cruz scrambles to reverse his fortunes in Indiana's do-or-die primary
body: cnn politics nightcapmay by eric bradner cruz scrambles to reverse his fortunes in do or die indiana ted cruz is getting the one on one shot he s always wanted against donald trump in indiana s tuesday primary but with polls showing trump ahead the texas senator could be poised to confront a harsh reality that has kept him from achieving his promise to unite the party his inability to reach economic conservatives in indiana cruz played hard to his socially conservative base but many of the indiana republicans he ll need tuesday are already exhausted by years of social battles making things even tougher the biggest pool of winnable voters suburban moderates in the doughnut counties around indianapolis didn t fall neatly into cruz s camp as he hoped they would after he struck a deal to have john kasich skip indiana the texas senator s efforts to address that weakness with economic conservatives many indiana republican operatives told nightcap fell short his economic message in indiana largely involved borrowing trumpâ s talking points about a localmanufacturer carrier that plans to shift jobs to mexico and he waited until monday to dispatch carly fiorina to work those suburbs cruz s closing message i trust the people of indiana to differentiate we are not a bitter angry petty bigoted people that is not america i reject that vision of america he said in osceola democrats clinton downplays indiana as sanders seeks win hillary clinton visited hammond and mishawaka last week and indianapolis on sunday but make no mistake her campaign is trying as hard as possible to look like one that s about to lose tuesday s primary clinton s camp didn t air a television ad in indiana it opened only five offices and she held just one rally and two invite only events spokesman brian fallon sought to portray indiana as a must win for bernie sanders on monday and pointed out that it is a largely white state saying he has spent millions of dollars in indiana we havenâ t been up at all here in indiana indiana is also a state in terms of tomorrow where demographically and the fact it is an open primary it resembles very closely a lot of the states where he has had his biggest wins why is clinton s camp so dour the michigan loss taught her aides something about expectations management but she defeated barack obama in indiana in it s no brush off state the democratic establishment here is behind her if her aides are convinced she can t win the question is why not a loss could suggest clinton hasn t yet turned the corner with white working class voters sanders boasted in fort wayne monday night about taking on the most powerful political organization in the country he said as he often does that his hopes ride on a large voter turnout and indiana could give it to him the state s primary is open which means independents can participate in it for sanders that s a welcome change from the last six east coast contests buzzingthe guy in blue face paint was really feeling the bern in fort wayne last call in west virginia clinton apologizes for coal miner remarks that s when clinton apologized saying her out of business remark was a misstatement taken out of context â what i was saying is that the way things are going now we will continue to lose jobs thatâ s what i meant to say â she said promising copley she d do whatever i can regardless of whether people are yelling at me and whether people are misrepresenting me or whether people are not looking at everything i say and taking something out of context thatâ s part of it i understand that but iâ m going to get up every single day trying to figure out what to do to help you provide the kind of future for your children that they deserve to have california gop unhappy with cleveland convention cheap seats eyes on why marco rubio hasn t endorsed ted cruz rubio s own explanation â at this point no itâ s not a year where endorsements matter very much â he told caputo â and no iâ ll just let it play itself out and work through it i really want to come back and focus on my work in the senate â cnn poll americans agree clinton trump headed for a faceoff the national republican numbers trump has support to ted cruz s and john kasich s among those not already backing trump nearly half say the gop front runner is their second choice of non trump voters say that if the candidate they support doesn t get the nomination trump is their backup about a third choose either kasich or cruz and say their second choice is someone other than the remaining three candidates trump also prompts the most enthusiasm of the remaining three candidates say they will be enthusiastic if he wins the nomination would feel that way about cruz and about kasich more say they would be dissatisfied or upset with cruz or kasich than say the same about trump on the democratic side clinton leads to bernie sanders about where the race stood in march straight up cruz didn t do anything even i would have helped her ok tipsyclosing timepaid contentget the nightcap a comprehensive summary of the most important political news delivered to your inbox daily â tips thoughts and beer recommendations are always welcome at nightcap cnn com mailto nightcap cnn com copyright â cable news network lp lllp a time warner company all rights reserved all rights reserved you are receiving this message because you subscribed to the cnn politics nightcap newsletter our mailing address is cable news network lp lllp a time warner company all rights reserved one cnn centeratlanta ga usa

jordan i can definitely stop by the dnc tomorrow i was hoping to meet somewhat on the earlier side if that works for you was planning on heading back to durham in the afternoon thanks so much alliehi allie sorry for the delay yeah can you stop by the dnc tomorrow over on the hill what works for you thanksjordan kaplannational finance directordemocratic national committee o c kaplanj dnc org lt mailto kaplanj dnc org gt lt efa e c d bc d cd dd png gt jordan hi just wanted to check in and see if you had any time to meet up tomorrow while i m here i understand you re incredibly busy but i just thought i d reach out again thanks so much allie talleringbegin forwarded message date may at am edtjordan i am coming to dc next week and was wondering if you would be willing to have a coffee with me to discuss some career stuff i would love to be able to hear more about the dnc and what you do lucy has been very kind to me in trying to hook me up with people who may be able to help thanks so much in advance best allie talleringallie meet dear friend former chicagoan and dnc finance director jordan kaplan jordan meet allie a chicagoan just about to graduate from duke allie worked for ready for hillary and is looking to live the democratic political dream in dc or nyc after graduation if you two can meet some time soon that would be amazing i will let you take it from here all the best lucysent from my iphone
call you in a bitdo you have a minute to talk jordanjordan kaplannational finance directordemocratic national committee o c kaplanj dnc org lt mailto kaplanj dnc org gt lt efa e c d bc d cd dd png gt

sub: RE: For approval: Amy April deadline
body: goodjacquelyn lopez perkins coie llpassociate thirteenth street n w suite washington dc d f e jacquelynlopez perkinscoie com lt mailto jacquelynlopez perkinscoie com gt admitted in state of florida admission to dc bar pending sent from my iphonegood can i just get the landing page for v jacquelyn lopez perkins coie llpassociate thirteenth street n w suite washington dc d f e jacquelynlopez perkinscoie com lt mailto jacquelynlopez perkinscoie com gt admitted in state of florida admission to dc bar pending looks great one edhi all four emails below to send from amy tomorrow around our end of month deadline let us know any flags thanks v ejb friend we have days left to do absolutely everything we can to make sure that our next president is a democrat that they have a democratic senate to work with and that we elect other great democrats up and down the ballot in all states it s a big job but i know we have what it takes to get it done because we have supporters like you name donorsyou ve already chipped in xx so far during this election and i can t thank you enough for that it s what helps us keep the lights turned on around here yes but it also builds the war chest we ll need to face the republicans and puts democrats in the best possible position to win in november now is the time when we need everyone to dig a little deeper to help us cross that finish line and we re counting on grassroots supporters like you to help us get there we have a big deadline coming up on saturday name can i count on you to step up again and chip in or more right now linksnondonorsdonations from grassroots supporters like you are what help us keep the lights turned on around here yes but they also build the war chest we ll need to face the republicans and put democrats in the best possible position to win in november now is the time when we need everyone to dig a little deeper to help us cross that finish line and we re counting on folks like you to help us get there we have a big deadline coming up on saturday name can i count on you to chip in or more right now linksthank you so much for everything you do all the best amyamy k daceychief executive officerdemocratic national committee v sk we re just over six months from election day name lt link gt that means we ve got less than days to give democratic candidates up and down the ballot the resources they ll need to build winning campaigns and defeat their republican opponents in november lt link gt we still have a few more caucuses and primaries between now and our convention in july but we already know this whether it s hillary clinton or bernie sanders who wins the primary our nominee needs to be ready to hit the ground running to beat whoever the republicans nominate donorsand name the xx that you ve chipped in so far this election is going to help us keep a republican out of the white house but the stakes are too high to take even one of these days between now and november th for granted and we need our best grassroots supporters people like you to keep stepping up so our great candidates have a fighting chance before saturday s deadline will you pitch in or more one more time to help elect democrats linksnondonorsand name the stakes are too high to take even one of these days between now and november th for granted so we need our grassroots supporters to step up so our great candidates have a fighting chance before saturday s deadline will you pitch in or more to help elect democrats linksi know democrats can count on you name all the best amyamy k daceychief executive officerdemocratic national committee v rae friend remember a couple months ago when we were welcoming in the new year if your answer to that is sure vaguely well that makes two of us name we are state primaries and caucuses in to just days away from our convention in philadelphia and only a little over six months away from the day we elect our next democratic president of the united states lt link gt but before then we re facing major deadlines like the one coming up this saturday your donation of or whatever you can today helps prepare us for those rapidly approaching days ahead of us lt link gt those are some pretty big countdowns ahead of us name every last day leading up to these milestones matter tremendously and i m hoping that you ll help us keep up the momentum we need to win starting with our deadline this saturday linksi know we ask a lot of you name and i want you to know how much i appreciate your support this year is moving fast and we can t let any opportunity to support democrats pass us by all the best amyamy k daceychief executive officerdemocratic national committee v jgr friend we re less than days from our convention a little over six months from election day and we ve had state primaries and caucuses so far so i wanted to take a minute to let you know where things stand here s how you ve been a part of our efforts so far this election non actiontakersemail subscriber yes we re glad to have you here online action taker no lt link gt if you want to let us know you re standing with democrats click here lt link gt election donor not yetnondonorsemail subscriber yes we re glad to have you here online action taker yep thanks for showing your support for democrats election donor not yetdonorsemail subscriber yes we re glad to have you here online action taker yep thanks for showing your support for democrats election donor yes and we appreciate it more than i can say name no matter how you choose to get engaged with the democratic party and our amazing candidates both at the presidential level and down the ticket in all states we re so glad that you re on the team because at the end of the day we all know that we simply can t allow a president trump to replace barack obama in the white house and to stop that from happening we ve all got to work together harder than we ever have before i know we can do it but we need to dig deep that s why today i m asking you to step up donors again and pitch in or whatever you can before saturday s end of month deadline linkswith another democrat in the white house and a democratic congress to back him or her up we re not just going to protect president obama s progress we re going to build on it so that generations of americans to come have a fair shot to succeed thank you for everything you do all the best amyamy k daceychief executive officerdemocratic national committee jessalyn reiddeputy email directordemocratic national committeereidj dnc org lt mailto sub: How to Read an Insurance Policy: Understanding Your Coverage Before a Loss Occurs. Register!
body: to see the web version of this message click here in conjunction with commerciallawwebadvisorhow to read an insurance policy â understanding your coverage before a loss occursâ examining the basic components of a commercial insurance policy to help you understand yourâ coverage and identify areas that put your financial institution at risk despite the near ubiquity of insurance in modern commerce and business management many professionals even in risk management and legal departments have very little understanding of how their insurance policies work or what they may or may not cover should a loss occur the law in virtually every state holds that a policyholder is assumed to have read understood and agreed to all of the terms of every policy it buys realistically that almost never happens although each policy is different the vast majority of commercial insurance policies share the same anatomy given what is at stake should a policyholder face a loss it is critical that attorneys risk management professionals and business owners understand the components of their policies to ensure that they are adequately covered or identify areas of risk exposure please join joseph g balice as he discusses the common components of insurance policies and special considerations you should take into account to help you understand your coverage and identify risk areas before a problem arises date june â pmâ eastern duration scheduled for minutes including question and answer session price â webinar cd webinar cd each live option may be viewed by unlimited attendees from the same connection cd includes recorded presentation question and answer session and presentation slides cd options subject to a handling charge cpe credits live webinar approved for nasba credit hours management advisory services business law presenter â joseph g balice partner brutzkus gubner rozansky seror weber llp los angeles california who should attend financial officers board of directors management internal auditors external auditors accountants lawmakers educators regulatorswhat you ll learnâ the program will discuss certain practical limitations and obstacles in insurance contract formationexplain the basic language of insurance policiesbreak down a policy into its essential elements common to all policiesdescribe how each component serves the policy as a wholeaddress special issues including endorsements riders certificates and renewalshighlight the hidden terms of insurance policiesand much more your conference leaderyour conference leader forâ how to read an insurance policy understanding your coverage before a loss occursâ is joseph g balice joe is a partner with brutzkus gubner rozansky seror weber llp in los angeles california as a member of the firm s commercial civil litigation team joe s core practice is representing policyholders when insurance company carriers deny claims prior to joining brutzkus gubner joe worked as part of the nationally recognized insurance recovery practice group in the firm of anderson kill he has worked on virtually all lines of commercial and professional insurance cgl d amp o e amp o epli property crime etc and has personally helped clients collectively recover over million in insurance policy benefits throughout his career financialofficerwebadvisor quality commitmentfinancialofficerwebadvisor a division of dkg media lp wants you to be satisfied with your webinar if this webinar does not meet your expectations email us atâ service financialofficerwebadvisor com mailto service financialofficerwebadvisor com â â certificate of participationfinancialofficerwebadvisor certificates of participation are available to everyone completing this webinar about commerciallawwebadvisor â commerciallawwebadvisor s mission is to provide timely and authoritative information to commercial lawyers in house counsel and legal staff via our comprehensive webinars thank you for reading thisâ financialofficerwebadvisorâ advertisement s mopac expressway â â â barton oaks plaza v suite â â â austin texas â â service financialofficerwebadvisor com

sub: POLITICO's 2016 Blast: Boehnerâ€™s revenge â€” Trumpâ€™s acceptance and denial â€” What Bernie wants â€” 5 things you need to know
body: by henry c jackson pm edthow do you really feel hey john boehner remember him well ted cruz sure does boehner allowed his inner trump to come out cruz said same party name calling is one thing but boehner s comments shifted the focus from trump just as cruz hopes to mount a last stand in indiana that job is harder now tgit here s your blast henry c jackson henrycjjackson is here to guide you through the day s campaign news so send your tips complaints and most scorching hot takes to hjackson politico com what matters here are four more things we re watching today and why they matter self funded donald trump has made his wealth his lack of beholdenness to other wealthy people and his promise to self fund his campaign pillars of his message but trump seems to be having second thoughts about this paul manafort a top trump aide says in a radio interview with laura ingraham that trump has actually not yet decided whether he will accept large contributions from outside donors for a general election well the point is that donald trump has been making on the campaign trail is that he s financing his own campaign manafort told ingraham but he added when it comes to the general election we are no longer running as an individual we are running as the head of atrail mix elsewhere on the campaign trail bobby knight has some things to say ted cruz can t contain himself carly fiorina emerges donald trump will find protesters in california and bill richardson thinks bernie sanders should chill out what s next donald trump makes a campaign visit to california tonight hillary clinton and bernie sanders focus on indiana ted cruz has events there too they said it i have democrat friends and republican friends i get along with almost everyone but i have never worked with a more miserable son of a bitch in my life follow politico s politics team politicocharlie politico steve politicoalex anniekarni glennthrush elistokols katieglueck schreckreports gdebenedetti hadas gold ec schneider kyledcheney theodoricmeyer marcacaputo politicokevin mikeallen dlippman danielstrauss henrycjjackson shanegoldmacher kristinpolitico politicoscott patrick c reisthere you go now you re caught up on the race we ll see you back here tomorrow to view online

agreedsent from my iphonei can send an alert to the state parties not to respond to this inquiry examiner is a right wing ragadding julie greene who manages the delegate certification processok this is sketchy anyone else seen this washington examiner request from other state parties i m sure you guys have seen these forwarded message date tuesday may hi leigh i m just circling back on this the washington examiner is assembling a list of names and emails of all of the delegates who will be at the dnc who should i connect with to get the connecticut democrats information thanks madeleine morgensternhi leigh this is madeleine morgenstern at the washington examiner magazine we re in the early planning stages for the souvenir issue we ll be handing out at the convention in july among other things we ll be publishing the names and email addresses of all the delegates in the magazine not only will it be a keepsake of their time there it ll allow them to reach out to each other during the week i m trying to find out who i specifically need to talk to for this information from the connecticut democrats and when i should be requesting that info if i can help or answer any questions feel free to write back or call me at lt tel gt thank you madeleine morgensterndigital editor the washington examiner madeleine morgensterndigital editor the washington examiner leigh applebycommunications directorconnecticut democratic party arbor street hartford ct lappleby ctdems org lt mailto lappleby ctdems org gt

body: this is awesome sent from my iphoneconnecticut will become the th state to implement automatic voter registration joining oregon california vermont and west virginia unlike the other states connecticut is implementing the law administratively rather than administratively breaking connecticut to automatically register voterssecretary of the state denise merrill told thinkprogress that an estimated eligible voters will be added to the rolls â it shouldnâ t be a big effort on anyoneâ s part to register to vote â she said â and once people take that first affirmative step of registering itâ s like their first act of citizenship it makes them really go seek out info about elections and makes them much more likely to vote â the secretary of stateâ s office and the connecticut dmv hammered out a memorandum of understanding over the past few months to share data in order to register voters while the automatic system is still in the works over the next two years the connecticut dmv will reach out more aggressively to voters and give them the option to register at all dmv offices by mail or on the dmvâ s mobile app â the only limitation is that this only works for people with a drivers license or state id â merrill said â so there is still is group of people weâ re not going to reach personally i think that once you turn and youâ re a citizen you should automatically be a voter but about percent of population has some sort of license or id from the dmv so this moves us one step closer to covering everybody â though the state began working on the automatic registration plan before the lawsuit was filed merrill told thinkprogress â weâ re hoping it makes a difference and the justice department can see weâ re making real progress â pratt norton wileynational director of voter expansiondemocratic national committeew m wileyp dnc org lt mailto wileyp dnc org gt prattwiley lt image png gt

sec clinton won the guam caucusesgood morning a few hours ago the guam caucus took place and we wanted to share with you and your teams some topline information on their delegate selection process on our side there are pledged delegates up for grabs below please find a brief summary of the process attached you will find the internal fact sheet we will send around results when they are released as always please let us know if you have any questions guam caucus may the caucus begins at am chst pm est on may the caucus will be held at the agana shopping center in hagatna guam results will be announced from the guam chairman joaquin perez there are a total of pledged delegates that will be allocated proportionally based on saturdayâ s results a percent threshold is required in order for a presidential contender to received pledged delegates at either the congressional district or statewide level the delegate breakdown is at large delegatesin addition to the pledged delegates there are unpledged delegates from guam republican processthe republican caucus took place on saturday march a territorial caucus convened as a convention to choose delegates to the republican national convention there is no formal system to relate the presidential preference of the convention participants to the choice of the delegates to the republican convention in addition party leaders the national committeeman the national committeewoman and the chairman of the guam s republican party will attend the convention as unpledged delegates by virtue of their position lt caucus state summaries gu docx gt

sub: POLITICO Influence: Anne Wall to Duberstein, Frank to Mercury, Moultrie to SBD, Knuti to UFCW â€” 'Election Introspective' with Karl Rove â€” Young Professionals for Ryan
body: by isaac arnsdorf pm edtwith help from brianna gurciullo mary lee and daniel lippmantransitions anne wall is joining the duberstein group as vice president she was previously assistant secretary for legislative affairs at the treasury department deputy assistant to the president for legislative affairs and floor director and office counsel for then senate majority whip dick durbin d ill anne played a pivotal role in securing some of treasury s signature policy accomplishments including trade promotion authority imf quota reform and the joint comprehensive plan of action with iran as well as in protecting key administration priorities including the affordable care act and the dodd frank wall street reform and consumer protection act treasury secretary jack lew said in a statement ayal frank joined mercury he was senior legislative assistant to rep james maloney d conn on defense national security foreign affairs and trade he also worked for the washington institute for near east policy and founded the united states kurdistan business council mercury s recent foreign clients include turkey japan s okinawa prefecture qatar and uganda digital public affairs and advocacy firm beekeeper group recently hired two new account managers angela barnett from hager sharp and previously the credit union national association and walter torres from the air line pilots association christina dipasquale started her own communications firm balestra media after fitzgibbon media s demise she ran media relations for sunday s screening at tribeca of the documentary when elephants fight produced and narrated by robin wright about mining in the democratic republic of congo communications and public affairs firm clyde group hired shannon murphy as health care director from burson marsteller thomas w ross the former president of davidson college and the university of north carolina system will lead the nonpartisan volcker alliance h t blj worldwide happy tuesday thanks for reading pi please keep the tips coming to iarnsdorf politico com soul searching karl rove will speak at an election introspective amp reception benefiting rep jim renacci r ohio america s future fund pac and the national republican congressional committee at the firestone country club in akron ohio this weekend political adviser and restaurateur fritz brogan sandboxx ceo sam meek christian hoehner of the data coalition writer kathleen rooney dane bahnsen of wise public affairs liam donovan of associated builders and contractors gator greenwill of gkg capital management nate walton of sachem strategies and jerri henry of campaign for platform reform amp protect internet freedom are hosting a young professionals reception for speaker paul ryan and rep elise stefanik r n y tonight according to an invitation obtained by playbook s daniel lippman lobbyists for trump jack burman founder of lobbying firm jm burkman amp associates is organizing one of the first fundraisers for donald trump who has volubly spurned special interests reports david catanese for u s news amp world report burkman said he hopes to raise as much as lobbyists for hillary craig snyder gop lobbyist and consultant is mobilizing republican members on k street for hillary clinton in an email to former staffers of the late sen arlen specter obtained by roll call s kate ackley snyder said of course i don t presume anything about any of your views but am writing in the hopes of finding out anyone who might be interested in being associated in any way or to any degree with a republicans for hillary effort i would very much appreciate it if you would let me know at your earliest convenience the email s recipients includes dan renberg who lobbed for trump in and american continental group s david urban who s volunteering for the campaign unfollow facebook is doing damage control with conservative leaders after reports it suppressed right wing news sources report tony romm and hadas gold for politico if they start to get labeled as a biased platform that s absolutely going to impact how i think conservatives spend money how they think about the platform and their trust in what they re reading said vincent harris head of republican digital consulting firm harris media facebook has reached out to republican national committee chairman reince preibus and the national republican congressional committee and ceo mark zuckerberg will meet wednesday with barry bennett top trump aide zac moffat formal digital adviser for mitt romney conservative commentator glenn beck s e cupp political commentator on cnn and former sen jim demint president of the heritage foundation green labor rift the afl cio s anti trump partnership with billionaire climate activist tom steyer drew protests from eight union presidents including sean mcgarvey politico s brian mahoney and anna palmer reported some member unions are embracing environmentalism to further its progressive agenda but tothers fear the afl cio is fostering financial and political interests that conflict with its members interests spotted rightnow women pac last night had its may day event with sens kelly ayotte r n h and tim scott r s c reps renee ellmers r n c and susan brooks r ind kathy szeliga running for maryland u s senate jenn higgins chamber hill strategies elizabeth brooks cvs health jean card jean card ink walter torres beekeeper group jane adams johnson amp johnson sabrina schaeffer independent women s forum patty stolnacker koch vmware catie horst emergent biosolutions anita mcbride american university joyce gates warehouse productions shelley hymes angel enterprises sue zoldak the zoldak agency and april canter the distilled spirits council provided a bourbon tasting booth all in together a nonpartisan campaign to empower women in civic social and political issues brought women executives to capitol hill today for their spring women s leadership day from sanofi pwc state street ey ocrolus seimans kate spade deloitte girl rising and kkr they met with amy dacey of the dnc katie walsh of the rnc sen lisa murkowski r alaska senior senate staffers the white house and u s treasurer rosie rios h t the group new joint fundraising committees brad wenstrup victory fund non qualified non party joint fundraiser nrsc targeted state victory committee non qualified non party sub: RE: For approval: POTUS emails for 5/20
body: i am without flagstwo non legal edits in yellow highlight just shoot me finals of these and the flotus emails going out this week for the wh jacquelyn lopez perkins coie llpassociate thirteenth street n w suite washington dc d f e jacquelynlopez perkinscoie com lt mailto jacquelynlopez perkinscoie com gt admitted in state of florida admission to dc bar pending thanks comms legal let me know if you have any flags here date monday may at amlooks greathi all a few emails from the president to send later this week let me know if you have any flags and thanks v ejb election day is now less than six months away name republicans have their presumptive nominee and are going to have to start asking themselves some hard questions whether this nominee really speaks for them and represents their values whether this nominee is really someone who can lead a country that is only growing more diverse let me be clear we live in serious times and this is a serious job over the next few months it is imperative that we remember and remind our friends and neighbors that this is not entertainment this is not a reality show this is a contest for president of the united states and all of the responsibilities of that office that s why i m going to do everything i can between today and november th to make sure a democrat succeeds me in office too much is at stake not to take this race as seriously as we ever have and i hope you re as committed as i am to making sure we win this linkwe can t do this without you name i really mean that thank you for standing with us barack obama v rae friend one of the things i ll be proudest of when i leave this office is that we didn t limit ourselves to addressing only the problems that affect us personally whether it was ensuring that young people could graduate from college without the burden of debt to protecting health care for those with serious medical conditions to setting the wheels in motion to protect our planet for generations to come we rallied together not just for ourselves but for our fellow americans and we know that that our country is stronger because of it so at this particular time in this election i look to folks like you name and want to say two things thank you for everything you ve done so far and let s do everything we can to ensure that our next president will continue to fight for every american linkthank you name barack obama v sk friend for the past four decades democratic leadership in the white housue has made our country great by strengthening our economy producing jobs and reducing our deficit meanwhile republican administrations have been marked by lowering taxes for the wealthiest among us and cutting vital government programs and services that hardworking american families rely on that s just history so yes the republicans now have a presumptive nominee but the truth is there really is nothing new about what the republican party believes they still deny that climate change is real they still want to take away a woman s right to choose and they still seek to repeal obamacare and reverse all of the progress we ve made together so really name our decision in this election is pretty easy we can do everything we can to make sure our next president is a democrat who will keep our country moving forward or we can let the republicans put someone in office who won t you can count on me to do whatever i can to help elect democrats up and down the ballot in november name add your name if i can count on you to do the same linkthanks for your help name barack obama
